trans-unit.source: Provides a set of ASP.NET run-time services for the current application.
The HttpRuntime object is used at the beginning of the ASP.NET pipeline model that processes HTTP requests.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpRuntime.ProcessRequest%2A> method drives all subsequent ASP.NET Web processing.
Page developers can use the HttpRuntime class properties to find out information about the current application domain for diagnostic purposes, for example.

Developers creating custom process pipeline or a custom hosting environment should call the <xref:System.Web.HttpRuntime.ProcessRequest%2A> method from a class derived from the <xref:System.Web.HttpWorkerRequest> or <xref:System.Web.Hosting.SimpleWorkerRequest> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRuntime"></xref> class.
Gets the application identification of the application domain where the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRuntime"></xref> exists.
`AppDomainAppID` uniquely identifies the application.
It does not change after the application is restarted and a new application domain is created.
The application identification of the application domain where the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRuntime"></xref> exists.
Gets the physical drive path of the application directory for the application hosted in the current application domain.
The physical drive path of the application directory for the application hosted in the current application domain.
Gets the virtual path of the directory that contains the application hosted in the current application domain.
The virtual path of the directory that contains the application hosted in the current application domain.
Gets the domain identification of the application domain where the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRuntime"></xref> instance exists.
`AppDomainID` changes whenever the application is restarted and a new application domain is created.
The unique application domain identifier.
Gets the folder path for the ASP.NET client script files.
The folder path for the ASP.NET client script files.
ASP.NET is not installed.
Gets the virtual path for the ASP.NET client script files.
The virtual path for the ASP.NET client script files.
Gets the physical path of the directory where the ASP.NET executable files are installed.
The physical path to the ASP.NET executable files.
ASP.NET is not installed on this computer.
Gets the physical path to the /bin directory for the current application.
The path to the current application's /bin directory.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.Caching.Cache"></xref> for the current application.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Web.Caching.Cache?displayProperty=fullName> class.
The current <xref href="System.Web.Caching.Cache"></xref>.
ASP.NET is not installed.
Shuts down the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRuntime"></xref> instance.
This method is provided for use when your code implements its own hosting environment.
There is no need to call this method in the course of normal request processing.
Gets the physical path to the directory where the common language runtime executable files are installed.
The physical path to the common language runtime executable files.
Gets the physical path to the directory where ASP.NET stores temporary files (generated sources, compiled assemblies, and so on) for the current application.
The physical path to the application's temporary file storage directory.
Returns the set of permissions associated with code groups.
GetNamedPermissionSet is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
A <xref href="System.Security.NamedPermissionSet"></xref> object containing the names and descriptions of permissions, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if none exists.
Gets the version of IIS that is hosting this application.
The version includes major version and minor version; for example, 7.0, 7.5, 8.0, etc.
The version of IIS that is hosting this application, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if this application is not hosted by IIS.
Gets a value that indicates whether the application is mapped to a universal naming convention (UNC) share.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the application is mapped to a UNC share; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the physical path to the directory where the Machine.config file for the current application is located.
The physical path to the Machine.config file for the current application.
Drives all ASP.NET Web processing execution.
This method is provided for use when your code implements its own hosting environment.
It also can be used to execute child requests when your code implements its own <xref:System.Web.HttpWorkerRequest>.
An <xref href="System.Web.HttpWorkerRequest"></xref> for the current application.
The wr parameter is .
The Web application is running under IIS 7 in Integrated mode.
Gets the version of the .NET Framework that the current web application targets.
This property is normally set by using the `targetFramework` attribute of the `httpRuntime` element in the Web.config file.
This property is not guaranteed to return a correct value if the currentapplication domain is not an ASP.NET application domain.
The version of the .NET Framework that the current web application targets.
Terminates the current application.
The application restarts the next time a request is received for it.
`UnloadAppDomain` is useful for servers that have a large number of applications that infrequently receive requests.
Rather than keep application resources alive for the lifetime of the process, `UnloadAppDomain` allows programmatic shutdown of unused applications.
Gets a value that indicates whether the current application is running in the integrated-pipeline mode of [!INCLUDE[iisver](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
Integrated-pipeline mode is not available in versions of IIS earlier than [!INCLUDE[iisver](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the application is running in integrated-pipeline mode; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
